contextId.information: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so all instances of "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: your God has blessed you ... your hand ... your walking ... your God ... with you, and you have lacked

contextId.information: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so all instances of "you" and the command "do not trouble" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: You are ... you come ... do not trouble ... give you

contextId.information: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so all instances of "you" and "your" and the commands "begin to possess" and "fight" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: your hand ... Begin to possess it ... fight ... terror of you ... news about you ... because of you

contextId.information: Yahweh is speaking to Moses as if Moses were the Israelites, so the command "do not fear" and all instances of "you" and "your" are plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh said to me, 'Do not fear him; ... given you ... under your control ... You will do ... as you did ... at Heshbon.'

contextId.information: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so all instances of "you" and "your" and the words "lift," "look," and "be drawn" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: You shall not lift your eyes ... and look ... and be drawn ... Yahweh your God

contextId.information: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one person, so the words "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh your God has forbidden you ... Yahweh your God

contextId.information: The word "you" here is plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: you will seek

contextId.information: Moses is speaking to all the Israelites here, so these words are all plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: you will deal ... you will break ... dash ... cut ... burn

contextId.information: Here "you" refers to the Israelites that are present with Moses and also the Israelites of the previous generation. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: how you provoked Yahweh

contextId.information: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the word "your" here is singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh your God

contextId.information: Here the word "you" refers to all the Israelites and is plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: chose you

contextId.information: Here "you" includes their ancestors that were slaves for many years. AT: "remember that your people were once slaves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: remember that you were a slave

contextId.information: Here "You" refers to all the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: You must not

contextId.information: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if he were speaking to one man, so the word "your" is singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh your God

contextId.information: These commands are addressed to Israel as a group and so are plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: take ... and stone

contextId.information: Moses speaks here to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: When you march out as an army against your enemies, then you must keep yourselves

contextId.information: Moses speaks to the Israelites here as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" and the commands "take heed" and "call to mind" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: Take heed ... you carefully observe ... Call to mind what Yahweh your God

contextId.information: Moses is speaking to all the Israelites, so the word "you" is plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: I am commanding you

contextId.information: "The tender and delicate woman among you ... tenderness—even she." Moses is saying that not only those one would expect to eat their children, but even women of noble birth and normally very gentle, whom one would never expect to eat their children, will eat their children. The word "you" here is singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: The tender and delicate woman among you ... tenderness—she

contextId.information: Moses is speaking to the Israelites as a group, so all instances of "you" are plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh once rejoiced over you ... multiplying you ... rejoice over you in making you perish and in destroying you. You will be plucked

contextId.information: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the word "your" here is singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: your eyes

contextId.information: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the word "your" here is singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: your sandals ... your feet

contextId.information: Moses speaks to the Israelites as a group. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: against you today

contextId.information: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh your God ... with you ... fail you nor forsake you

contextId.information: - Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh your God ... you will read

contextId.information: Moses speaks to the Levites as if they were one man, so the word "you" is singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: witness against you

contextId.information: Moses speaks to the Levites as if they were one man, so the word "your" is singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: your rebellion and your stiff neck

contextId.information: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: Call to mind  ... think about ... your father ... show you ... your elders ... tell you

contextId.information: Moses is speaking to the Israelites as many people, so the word "your" is plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: your fathers

contextId.information: Moses speaks as if the tribe of Naphtali is one man, so these words are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
contextId.quote: take possession
